loans.name: Nemerlyn

texts.en:
Nemerlyn is a rice retailer in the village where she  lives with her spouse and two children. She is now 28 years old. She started to sell rice three years ago. Nemerlyn usually earns about P2,000 with each sack of rice she sells. She is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy two sacks of rice to sell. 

Additional revenue generated from the business will be saved for the school expenses of her children. She wants to give them the best education possible. She hopes someday, her children will earn a degree and seek good employment.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ilda Mercedes

texts.es: Ilda de 45 años se dedica al comercio de artículos de cacharrería; en su negocio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, se puede encontrar calculadoras, grapadoras, controles, forros para controles, en fin de todo un poco. Ilda vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 15 a 28 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas, pues en su condición de mujer separada, ha trabajado mucho con tal de sacarlos adelante. Ella cuando empezó su vida productiva, primero trabajó en almacenes de calzados, luego en un puesto de galletería y posteriormente cuando el propietario de este negocio partió y le dejó la instalación de su negocio,  fue agregando diversos artículos, hasta lograr adecuarlo a las necesidades, gustos y deseos de sus clientes, como los que hoy vende. Los productos de mayor salida comercial,  son los controles para DVD y para Televisores,  cuenta con clientes fijos entre los empleados de las empresas que se encuentran a su alrededor. Las compras las realiza en su mayoría de contado, porque le dejan un margen de ganancias superior, mientras sus ventas también las hace con el dinero en la mano;  con las estrategias utilizadas por Ilda su negocio está cada vez mas fortalecido.  Su expectativa de crecimiento es amplia, pero su gran desafío es el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para poder cumplir su sueño, esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará calculadoras, controles,en mayor volumen para continuar ganando descuentos y aprovechando un mercado cautivo y la demanda que en este existe.
texts.en:
Ilda, age 45, is a merchant who sells gadgets.  Her business is in the center of the city, and you can find calculators, staples, controls, cases for controls, and a little of everything there.

Ilda lives with three of her four children, who are between the ages of 15 and 28.  She dreams of them becoming successful people.  As a separated woman, she has worked a lot in order to get them ahead.  

When she started her productive life she first worked in a shoe store.  Then she worked at a biscuit stand.  Later, the the owner of the business departed and left his business facility.  When this happened she gathered different items until she managed to meet the needs, tastes, and wishes of her customers, like she does now.

The products that sell the most are the DVD and television controls.  She has fixed customers among the employees of the companies around her business.  Most of her purchases are for cash because that gives her a better profit margin.  She also makes her sales for cash.  Ilda’s business is strengthened more and more by the strategies she uses.

She hopes to grow a lot, but her big challenge is the working capital that it takes to be able to fulfill her dream.  That is exactly why she requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundacón Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy calculators and controls in greater volume in order to continue getting discounts.  She will continue to take advantage of a captive market and the demand that exits.

loans.use: to buy calculators and controls in greater volume

loans.name: Tressa

texts.en:
Tressa, a 31-year-old lady is married to Ivan, a 31-year-old man. They got married one year ago. Tressa owns a beauty salon business. Prior to running this business, Tressa had an accessories business. Currently she runs both businesses at the same place. Tressa employs two assistants to serve the customers. 

Tressa and her husband built a house to live in as well as to run the business in. She has spent their money to build the house, and now she would like to restock her beauty salon products and equipment. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to purchase a hair dryer, a hair steamer, a chair, a mirror, and other beauty salon equipment.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer,a  hair steamer, a chair, a mirror, and other beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia sells fish in the town of Cabatuan. She is 48 years old and is married. She has been blessed with three children. Her business serves as a source of income, and she earns about PHP 300 a day for these activities. 

Right now, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy fish such as tilapia and milk fish to sell. She aims to expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fish such as tilapia and milk fish to sell

loans.name: Sey

texts.en:
Sey, 58, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing maize and other agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who approximately earns USD 3 per day. One of her children is a construction worker as well. He earns about USD 4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Sey is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the  money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children get Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 45-year-old married man, a father with three sons and one daughter.

For the past two years, Mohammad has been making and selling different types of sweets, which has been a profitable project, while also not really generating enough income to cover the family's expenses.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary but missing  ingredients that are basic to making sweets such as: milk, butter, flour, sugar, and eggs. Taking out this loan will allow Mohammad to continue his work and compete with others well and have on hand the desired amount of sweets that customers often request. This will increase sales and improve Mohammad's income.

Mohammad is photographed in his store while he is selling sweets to customers.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya est une femme mariée, mère de six élève dont l'un seulement va à l'école.En fonction des périodes de forte production, elle vend soit des mangues, des arachides ou des feuilles d'oseille.Elle fait partie des premières clientes du guichet de l'UIMCEC de sa localité. Elle a déjà obtenu et payé 4 prets sans retards. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un autre pret de 100000f afin d'acheter des mangues et de l'arachide.Les revenus tirès de ce financement lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de ses enfants notamment les frais de scolarité de sa fille. Elle ambitionne d'ouvrir un magasin alimentaire.
texts.en:
Rokhaya is married and the mother of six children, only one of whom is in school. Depending on the production seasons, she sells mangos, groundnuts or sorrel leaves. 

Rokhaya is among the top customers of her local branch of UIMCEC. She has already obtained and repaid four loans without any delays. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting another loan of 100 000 francs for the purchase of mangos and groundnuts. The income from this loan will help her provide for her children, and pay for her daughter's school fees. Rokhaya hopes to open a food store.

loans.use: to buy mangos and groundnuts.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 22 years old. She is married and has two children. Christina sells fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a week for these activities.

Now, she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase different kinds of fish, such as milk fish and tilapia, to resell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish, such as milk fish and tilapia, to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Duterimbere I Group

texts.fr:
Françoise fait partie du groupe Duterimbere I et  habite à Gitega. Elle a  39 ans et est mariée à Jean, un commissionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants, âgé de 3 mois à 20 ans, dont 6 étudient.

Elle est  commerçante de farine de manioc depuis 6ans. 

Elle est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc sec  afin de préparer une grande quantité de farine à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain du business, lui permet de nourrir sa famille, acheter les habits  et payer les frais de scolarité.
texts.en:
Françoise is a member of the Duterimbere I group and lives in Gitega. She is 39 years old and married to Jean, a commissions agent. They have eight children, aged between three months and 20 years. Six of the children are studying. 

Françoise has been selling cassava flour for six years. This is her 17th loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cassava in order to prepare flour for resale. This will allow her to earn more. The profits from her business will go towards feeding her family and paying for clothes and school fees.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of dried cassava to prepare flour for resale.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 53 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es casada, es socia de Finca desde hace 15 años, y se dedica a la venta de ropa y teje chompas, ella es socia desde que era estudiante, y poco a poco ella pudo salir adelante, recuerda que en uno de los cumpleaños de la Morenita le fue a cantar con su esposo que toca el Arpa y así fue que conoció a nuestros fundadores y desde la fecha ella esta en Finca, agradece mucho todas las enseñanzas de Morenita, que los pudo poner en práctica. Ella le decía que las mujeres tienen que trabajar y ser autosuficientes y poder trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia, eso lo lleva bien presente para su vida, todo lo que aprendió en Finca Perú no solo le sirvió a ella sino a la educación de sus hijos y todos los valores que tiene como la responsabilidad, la puntualidad. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the Palmeras communal bank.  She is married and has three children.  She has been a member of Finca for 15 years; and she has been a member since she was a student.  She sells clothes and knits sweaters.

Little by little she was able to get ahead.  She remembers that on one of the Virgin de Guadalupe’s birthdays she went to sing with her husband who plays the harp.  That is how she met our founders, and from that date on she has been a member of Finca.

She is very grateful for the Virgin of Guadalupe’s teachings, which she was able to put into practice.  She says that women have to work and be self-sufficient.  They need to be able to work to get their families ahead.  She has always taken that to heart.  Everything that she learned in Finca Perú not only helps her, but it also helps raising her children.  All of the values it has like responsibility and punctuality help her and her children.  She will use this loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Kundana Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe Kundana  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à Boas, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 7enfants, âgé de 1 à 21 ans ; 6 parmi eux  étudient, les  deux premiers  sont à l’école secondaire, les suivants au primaire et un autre à la  maternelle.
Sa famille adopte 3 autres enfants.

Elle est vendeuse de bière industrielle  depuis 15ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des casiers de bière additionnels, toute la quantité sera revendue, pour gagner plus.

Elle espère  un avenir meilleur, car elle parvient à nourrir ses enfants, les habiller et payer les frais de scolarité.
texts.en:
Jeanine is a member of the Kundana group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and married to Boas, who is a driver. They have seven children aged between one and 21. Six of the children are in school: two at secondary school, three at primary, and one at kindergarten. Her family also cares for three other children.

Jeanine has been selling industrially-produced beer since the age of 15. This is her fourth loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and purchase additional crates of beer for resale, which will increase her income. She hopes for a better future, as she will be able to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy extra crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Turwanyubunebwe 22 B/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Nicolas fait partie du groupe Turwanyubunebwe. Il a 53 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 1 an à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 9 ans de primaire.

Nicolas est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Nicolas voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nicolas is part of the group Turwanyubunebwe. He is 53 years old and married, and he has five children, from 1 to 16 years old. Four of the children are in school. He has a 9th grade education.

Nicolas is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds and chemical fertilizers for his rice farming. In the next few years, Nicolas would like to be the No. 1 farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans on educating his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 49 years old and is married and has two children.

To make a living, Feliza owns and operates an agricultural business, raising crops. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Feliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to gain the ability to engage in business activities. Feliza is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and young seeds to plant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and young seeds to plant.

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
yolande est une jeune femme de 35 ans mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 6ans, deux de ces enfants vont déjà  à l'école. elle a un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 9 ans déjà mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour une crédit pour s'acheter une machine qui l'aidera dans ce dommaine appelée fait tout.

Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Yolande is a young woman, 35 years old, and the married mother of three children, from 2 to 6 years old. Two of the children are already going to school. Yolande has a small sewing workshop, which has been operating well for nine years. But it does not have all the supplies and equipment for quickly fulfilling her orders or for satisfying her customers on time. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a machine called "all-purpose" that will help in this area. 

The profits derived from this loan will enable her not only to buy her sundry sewing supplies but also to meet certain of her needs, as well as those of her small family.

loans.use: to buy an all-purpose machine

loans.name: Stephany Del Carmen

texts.es: Stephany de 22 años  vive con su cónyuge tiene una hija de 7 años de edad; su hija nació a los 15 años y ella terminó su bachillerato, dos años después de su nacimiento. Así fue como todo no fue muy fácil, pero siempre se sobrepuso, estudió enfermería, auxiliar de droguería y farmacia,  y con mucho esmero logró salir adelante, cuando su esposo reuniendo un capital , le ayudó a crear su propia oportunidad de ingresos donde hoy  ofrece servicios de internet, fotocopiadora y llamadas telefónicas . En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada en hacer crecer su negocio, por eso acude a su credikiva, con el que comprará una fotocopiadora mas y un computador, aprovechando que la demanda de este servicio cada vez mas se incrementa, porque no tienen competencia en el sector y esta es justamente la razón por la cual su inversión tendrá èxito.
texts.en:
Stephany, aged 22, lives with her husband with whom she has a 7-year-old daughter.  Her daughter was born when she was 15, and she completed her high-school baccalaureate two years after the birth.  Like everything, that wasn't easy, but she has always overcome challenges.  She studied nursing, to be a pharmacy and drugstore assistant, and with much dedication she has been able to move ahead.  

When her husband put together some capital, he helped her to create her own opportunity for income where today she provides internet, photocopying and telephone services.  She is currently very enthusiastic about growing her business, which is why she is coming for a Kiva loan.  With this, she will purchase an additional photocopier and a computer, taking advantage of the demand for this service which continues to increase as they have no competition in this sector.  This is exactly the reason that her investment will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase an additional photocopier and a computer.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 21 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con el papá y el hijo, viven en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC MUSHUC ÑAN está ubicada en la comunidad Guanto Cruz parroquia Guanujo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 11 socios y socias se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Luz María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, papas , arveja , además se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, cerdos, ovejas. 

 Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá funigar los cultivos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guanto Cruz semanalmente.

El sueño es poder tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son el mal clima y el transporte.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, disfrutar de la época de la navidad.
texts.en:
Luz María, 21, is single and has one child.  She lives with her father and her son in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Mushuc Ñan communal bank, located in the community of Guanto Cruz, parish of Guanujo, 60 minutes from our office.  It is made up of 11 men and women members who work in agriculture growing blackberries, growing corn, raising small animals, and raising dairy cows to make cheese.

Luz María works in agriculture growing blackberries, potatoes, and peas.  She also raises animals such as chickens, pigs, and sheep.

She is requesting the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, urea, and liquid herbicide.  With the help of the loan she will be able to fumigate the crops.  She makes her purchases and sales weekly in Guanto Cruz.

Her dream is to be able to have her own house.  The challenges she faces are bad weather and transportation.  In her free time she likes to watch television and enjoy the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, urea, and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is a 38-year-old retailer in Yerevan. He rents a little shop where he trades in food. Ashot has participated in the Artsakh war in the mid 90s, during which he injured his leg, which was amputated. 

After the war Ashot decided to start his business to provide a stable source of income for his family: his wife and two children. Ashot's wife helps him with the business. 

Ashot has applied for this loan to add some new inventory in his shop and increase the sales. With the loan's help he plans to purchase more food items to sell. This will help Ashot to increase his working capital and develop his business further.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 43 years of age, married and blessed with three children. Her primarily source of income comes from a sari-sari store business which sells a variety of goods in her village. She sells breads, beverages, soaps, shampoos, and spices. 

Nila’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in their field. Through her income from her sari-sari store, Nila provides their daily food and other household expenses. Her husband's profit from farming goes for the education of their children.

Nila wants to expand the products she sells to her customers in their village. She wishes to gain higher income to provide her children allowances for  school. Nila is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy coffee, sugar, milk and canned goods to sell. She hopes to avail herself of the loan and create good services to her customers.

loans.use: buy coffee, sugar, milk and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Chhang, 51, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over six years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation service (Tuk Tuk).  He earns approximately USD 5 per day. One of her children is a chef and earns about USD 3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s living without electricity, Chhang is requesting a loan of USD to pay for the electricity connection. In the future, she would like to build houses for rental and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: pay for electricity connection

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for over two years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed in a hotel. Approximately, they earn USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her husband's business, Rorn is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a walking tractor to till their farmland.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy a tiller

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 48-year-old widowed woman living with her three children. Two of them are still attending school while the other one is working. Samia works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. She has opened her own grocery store in 2007 in her town and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own minimarket.

loans.use: purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mehyi El Din

texts.en: Mehyi El Din is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, who are all studying. Although his wife is working, still he is considered the main source of income in the family.  His wife is a hair dresser and has been for six years. As for Mehyi El Din, he decided to have his own business in 2005, so he opened a barber shop. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his salon and buy a new generator. This Kiva loan will allow him attract added customers and therefore increase his revenues.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his business.

loans.use: renovate his hair salon and buy a new generator

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 31 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a17 años. Ella es oriunda de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a sus 14 años nació su primer hijo y esto la inspiró a buscar ingresos mediante un trabajo; posteriormente terminó su bachillerato y tuvo 3 hijos más, que aunque son apoyados económicamente por su  padre,  la siguen motivando en su tarea diaria productiva. Desde hace 6 años inició su propio negocio a través del cual vende ropa, calzado y mercancías variadas, las cuales distribuye a crédito entre clientes fijos; sus principales compradores son empleados de colegios y diversas empresas, que le encargan productos en el marco de la calidad que   María  ofrece. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  blusas, vestidos para damas y calzado, aprovechando que está por llegar el día internacional de la madre y esta es justamente la época en la que mas se incrementan sus ventas y lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión, porque los  pedidos de sus buenos  clientes son cada vez mayores  y ella podrá responder a su demanda. Su sueño mas adelante es tener su propia casa y apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos para que puedan tener un futuro exitoso
texts.en:
María, aged 31, lives in the south of the city with her four children aged between one and seventeen years old.  She is a native of the city of Barranquilla, and had her first child at the age of 14, which inspired her to look for income by working.  Later, she finished her high-school baccalaureate and had three more children. They continue to motivate her in her daily work, although they are supported financially by their father.

Six years ago, she started her own business selling clothing, shoes, and a variety of merchandise, which she sells on credit to steady customers.  Her principal purchasers are employees of schools and various business, who want products with the the level of quality provided by María.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, she will purchase blouses, women's clothing and shoes.  She will take advantage of the fact that International Mothers' Day is coming up, and this is exactly the time of year when her sales increase most.  This will guarantee the success of her investment, because each time the orders from her good customers get bigger, and she will be able to meet this demand.

Her dream for down the road is to have her own home and to be able to support her children's well-being so that they can have a successful future.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, women's clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 8 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns approximately USD 3 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Im is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase construction equipment for her husband to use in his business. This purchase would enable her husband to have enough equipment to use in his construction work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it stronger and to provide better living conditions for her family, and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy construction equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Evelyn runs a homed-base store.  She has been in this business for three years.  Evelyn is married and has only one child.

Evelyn and her husband aim to improve their business to gain bigger income for the preparation of their child's education and to satisfy their daily needs.  She had repaid back her previous loan and asked for another loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to allow her to buy more merchandise for her retail store.  She is indeed thankful for the financial support given by the ASKI to maintain and develop her business.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng is 34 years old and is a married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district in Kompong Cham. She is a responsible mother of 2 school-aged children.  Rice is the main source of the family’s income.  Sieng has been a farmer for more than 22 years. Also, she raises piglets at home for extra income.

As of now, Sieng would like to take out a loan from HKL to purchase timber to fix her house.  It’s old and she wants it to become stronger. She is very happy for the given loan to support her family.

loans.use: purchase timber to fix her house

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Madame  Adiaratou  a  41 ans, est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame  avec ses enfants, son mari  et sa coépouse dans  la préfecture de Koutiala.  
Madame Adiaratou n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis son enfance auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle entama l’activité de vente d’habits, de pagnes wax, de l’encense,…  depuis  plus de vingt ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit plusieurs commandes dans le mois. Pour l’agrandissement de son activité et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plusieurs ans.  Madame  a obtenu 4 prêts solidaires (prêts de groupe) auprès de Soro Yiriwaso tous correctement  remboursés et elle est à son 3 eme  prêt individuel. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali), à Lomé et souvent à Koutiala et compte acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax, des parfums pour l’encense et biens d’autres divers articles avec ce prêt. Elle effectue sa  vente dans la ville de Koutiala et  dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants  à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 95.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt  de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Dans ses perspectives  Madame  compte ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habit et divers dans le marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiaratou is a 41-year-old married mother of five children. She lives in a polygamous family with her children, her husband and his other wife in the prefecture of Koutiala.

Unable to get a formal education, Mrs. Adiaratou started to work in trade at an early age alongside her mother. After conducting several income-generating activities, she turned to the sale of clothing, wax pagnes, incense, etc. over twenty years ago. Her good reputation brings her many orders every month. 

Eager to expand her activity and achieve customer satisfaction, she quickly joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso several years ago. She previously obtained four group loans from Soro Yiriwaso, all of which were correctly repaid. She is now seeking her third individual loan. She buys her merchandise from merchants at the big market of Bamako (capital of Mali), in Lomé, and often in Koutiala. She plans to buy 20 wax pagnes, some perfume for the incense, and many other miscellaneous items. She sells her goods to a mixed clientele in the city of Koutiala and at the weekly fairs of surrounding villages, for cash or credit.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 95,000CFAF, which she will use to repay the loan interest and to help with the family’s daily expenditures. In future years, she plans to open a shop to sell clothing and various items at the Koutiala market.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year old married man with children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a tea plantation, which he started five years ago through his personal savings. He faces hardships of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops. Peter needs this loan to buy more tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy more tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina is a forty-eight-year old married woman living in Kasese Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children, to build a permanent home and to educate herself. She has been dealing in the construction of commercial houses, and has applied for a loan to help her finish up the construction. She faces hardships of high transportation costs and taxes, however she has a goal of moving this business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to construct her commercial house.

loans.name: Duo Belen Group

texts.es:
DUO BELEN
María Ofelia, ella tiene una venta de ropa típica desde hace 7 años nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para comprar más producto ya que le están pidiendo algunos estilos de blusas que ella no tiene entonces quiere comprar  e invertir también en delantales típicos que le están pidiendo, ella con su trabajo ayuda a su mama con el gasto de su casa y puede sacar para seguir estudiando ya que no saco su primaria y ahora ve la necesidad de seguir espera que se le apoye para ella poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Duo Belen

Maria Ofelia has been selling traditional clothes for the last 7 years. She tells us that she is requesting this loan to buy more product since her clients are asking her for some styles of blouses that she does not have. She also wants to buy and invest in traditional aprons that her customers are asking for.

With her work, she helps her mother with the home's expenses and pays her studies as she couldn't finish her primary education, which now she sees the need to have it. She hopes to get the support that she needs to be able to continue working.
.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met, 62, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a chef in a factory for over five years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation service (motor taxi) and earns about USD 3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Met is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a trailer for her husband to run a delivery service to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a motorbike repair shop for her husband and rebuild her present house to make it stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: buy a trailer for her husband's delivery service

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi, 47, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. 

Yi wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Yi is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase timber to cover her house’s walls. By doing so, she will get a convenient living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her youngest child get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: buy timber to improve her house

loans.name: Luz María  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Luz María  se reúne cada quince días en Los Bajos del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace un tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho ya que con el créditos que recibieron de la institución ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios  y su vida, es por eso que ellos desean realizar un nuevo crédito y así poder seguir adelante, en su mayoría se dedican al comercio en general.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Flor Lucciola, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo tres hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace varios años, los dos que tiene ya son mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección, profesión con la cual se gana la vida actualmente, tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde elabora una gran variedad de prendas ya que cose ropa tanto de hombres como de mujeres, en la actualidad está muy ocupada cosiendo uniformes de escuelas y colegios ya que se avecina el ingreso a clases y los niños y jóvenes necesitan sus uniformes. Lleva más de 15 años realizando dia a dia esta actividad ya que casi nunca le ha faltado el trabajo, trabaja con la ayuda de su hija.  Los fines de semana vende pollos a la brasa también en su casa con lo cual se gana algo extra.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales de costura para elaborar sus prendas, lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un taller con mejores maquinas y mas operadoras.	

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Luz María meets every two weeks in Los Bajos, in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned handicrafts. It is home to the famous Panama hat. 

This is a group of people who decided to get together some time ago and form this loan group, which has been very useful to them. The loans they have received from the institution have enabled them to improve their small businesses and their lives, and that is why they wish to achieve a new loan, so that they can keep on moving forward. Most of them work in business in general.

One of the members of this group is Flor Lucciola. She is 54 years old, married, and had three children from this marriage, though one of them passed away several years ago. The other two are now adults, and one of her daughters still lives with her.  Her husband is a driver.

Several years ago she learned dressmaking, an occupation which currently supports her. She has a small sewing shop in her home, where she makes a wide array of clothing items.  She sews both men and women's clothing, and she is currently very busy sewing school uniforms, since it is almost time to sign up for classes and the children and teenagers need their uniforms. She has been doing this daily for over 15 years, and she has hardly ever lacked for work. She gets help from her daughter. On weekends she sells barbecued chicken also from home, which brings in some extra income.

This loan is to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials to make her clothes.  She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and she appreciates the help she gets through the loans.

Her dream is to have a workshop with better machines and more operators.	

The two small pictures are of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing material.

loans.name: Teap's Group

texts.en:
Teap, 30, is a leader of a group with two members. She is married with two boys. She lives in Banteay Meanchey province and raises pigs and sells recycled materials. She has been in this work for around five years now. From these businesses, she can earn an average of 15,000 Riel per day. Out of that, 6,000 Riels are expenses.
 
Teap, after completely paying off her first loan, is now requesting for a second loan from VisionFund. Before the first loan, her life was very difficult, as she went to Thailand to work for others as a construction worker. She was then able to save up some amount of money and decided to come back to her hometown. With the loan from VisionFund, she started purchasing recycled materials for sale. The income generated was spent on family daily expenses and set aside for expanding the business.

If she was granted the second loan, Teap will use it to expand her business by buying more recycled materials for selling and two pigs and more feeds so that she can make more income to improve her family’s living condition and also keep her two boys in school.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials, pigs and pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married to Juan. They have two grown up children who live separately from them. Since Teresita doesn't want to rely on their remittances, she became involved in selling clothes and beauty products to the people in her village. She has already sold all of her beauty products.

Although Teresita only generates a minimal income from her business, she is happy to supplement her spouse's income from motorcycle transport services. They work hard everyday to improve their living conditions. Teresita is asking for a loan of PHP 28,000 to invest in diversifying her business. She will buy more clothes and beauty products, such as cosmetics and perfumes, to sell. In the future, Teresita would like to keep growing to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Maria Soraya

texts.es: Mayra de 29 años vive ( orquídeas Guayaquil ) ella decidió con su esposo  independizarse en los negocios porque antes trabajaban para otras personas  . tomaron la decisión de poner a vender fritada y les va bien . trabaja todos los días es casada su esposo la ayuda en el negocio tiene 3 hijos . a futuro anhela tener el local donde esta ahora y extender su negocio . con el préstamo comprar ( aceite chancho ).
texts.en: Mayra is 29 years old, and she lives in Orquídeas Guayaquil. She is married and she has 3 children. She and her husband have decided to become independent because they were previously working for other people. They have decided to start selling "fritada" (a dish made with pork and corn), and things are going well. She works every day and her husband helps her with the activity. In the future she hopes to own the shop she is currently using and to expand her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy oil and pork.

loans.use: To buy oil and pork.

loans.name: Juanalyn

texts.en:
Juanalyn, 35 years old, lives in Libag Sur with her spouse and three children. Victoriano, her spouse, operates a motorcycle transport service for the people in their village. Juanalyn cooks food for snacks such as lumpia (spring rolls), breads and juice, earning a minimum net profit of PHP 200 daily. The couple works untiringly to provide sustenance for the family, especially for their children's education expenses.
 
Juanalyn wants to improve her sales, so she is asking for a PHP 28,000 loan to invest in expanding her small store. She will use the loan to buy lumpia wrappers, cooking oil, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, and eggs to sell. 

In the future, Juanalyn would like to have a stable source of income to achieve financial independence. She also would like to keep improving her friendly services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, breads and eggs to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar, 58 years old, is married and has three children. Pilar raises hogs in her backyard and also sells fruits and vegetables to increase her income. She offers fruits and vegetables on a house-to-house basis, and adds the additional revenue acquired from the business to her savings for emergencies.

Pilar would like to make her business more profitable so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and onions to resell for a profit. This will help improve her income. In the future, Pilar would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Danilon Marina

texts.en:
Danilon Marina, 35 years old, is blessed with three children. She is married to a driver. To supplement her spouse's income, Danilon Marina raises hogs and resells them for a profit. She generates about PHP 2,500 whenever she sells a raised hog. Through her determination and patience, she is making her business profitable. She would like to keep improving it, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional piglets to raise, and pig feed and vaccines to sustain her pigs. Ensuring the hogs' good growth will allow her to offer them at a higher cost and gain a rewarding price. 

Danilon Marina would like to continuously provide a good education for her children and secure a good future for them.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, pig feed and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pedro  Joaquin

texts.es: Don Pedro tiene 55 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos, es una persona de escasos recursos económicos pero también es muy luchador. Don Pedro y su esposa hace algún tiempo se dedicaban a vender abarrotería en general, a través del tiempo su negocio iba decayendo ya que tenían mucha competencia por lo que decidió en poner una pequeña librería que poco a poco ha incrementado su clientela y por lo tanto sus ventas. El préstamo que solicita don Pedro lo necesita para la  compra de libretas, cuadernos únicos, lápices, borradores, reglas, colores, marcadores, etc. Una de las dificultades de don Pedro ha sido la falta de dinero para invertirlo en la compra de producto para poder surtir su librería con los materiales necesarios y que pueda tener mayor variedad, para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesiten. El está seguro que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ventas aumentaran y por lo tanto sus ingresos también. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y tenerlo mejor surtido. Ha tenido cinco ciclos con FAMA y no ha tenido problemas de mora, ya que ahorra a diario para pagar la cuota puntualmente.
texts.en: Pedro is 55 years old, is married and has six children.  He’s a person of limited means but is also a very hard worker.  Pedro and his wife have been selling general groceries for some time.  Over time their business began going under, due to all the competition, so he decided to open a small bookstore.  The number of customers, and therefore sales, have been growing little by little.  Pedro needs this loan to buy pads of paper, notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, crayons, markers, etc.  One of Pedro’s challenges has been the lack of capital to invest and stock his store with the necessary materials to have a large variety so that his customers will always find what they need.  He’s certain that with the support of this loan, his sales will increase.  His dream is to grow his business and have it better stocked.  He has had five cycles with FAMA and has not had any problems with default, since he saves up money to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sun Heng

texts.en:
Sun Heng, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been making and selling noodles for over six years, earning approximately US $5 per day. In order to improve her business, Sun Heng is requesting a loan of US $200 to purchase more equipment for her business. By doing so, she could produce noodles faster to sell to her clients.

In the future, Sun Heng would like to rebuild her house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family, and to help her children get their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to use in her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina operates a business raising hogs to sell for profit. She is 56 years old and married; her spouse works as a construction worker. Rosalina is thankful for acquiring a good income from her business, usually earning about PHP 2,000 for each hog she is able to sell. Rosalina wants to improve her income, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to establish a small store to increase her income. This will help her attain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines

loans.name: Nueva Integración (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Nueva Integración, los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, crías de animales y comercio en general. Para ellos este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, están repitiendo el crédito y nos cuentan que el crédito anterior les ayudo mucho ya que la situación estaba dura y no tenían capital para financiarse, y  gracias al crédito pudieron solucionar este problema y a pesar que estuvo duro el invierno si pudieron cancelar todo a tiempo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Norma, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 21, 18 y 15 años de edad, los tres  estudian dos en universidad y el menor en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica también al comercio, vende  artículos tanto para el hogar como artículos personales, ella vende planchas, ventiladores, zapatos, perfumes, entre otros muchos productos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ofrece sus productos a sus clientes, realiza los pedidos y entrega los productos los mismos que entrega a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 7 años realizando esta actividad y le va muy bien, ahora con los créditos lo ha mejorado mucho mas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, zapatos, planchas, tostadoras entre otras muchas cosas más. Está desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le bridan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir mejorando su negocio

La foto pequeña es  de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo. Los niños de la foto son hijos de algunas de las socias.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Integración communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Rosales, in the city of Portoviejo.  They each work in different things, such as agriculture, livestock, and general business.  This will be their third cycle in the communal bank.  They are requesting another loan and they tell us that the previous one helped them very much because the situation was difficult and they didn’t have any capital with which to finance themselves.  Thanks to the loan they were able to solve this problem and despite the hard winter they were able to repay it on time.

Norma is one of the group’s members.  She’s 41 years old and is in a live in relationship through which she had three children, ages 21, 18, and 15.  The two oldest are university students and the youngest attends school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She’s a good mother and housewife who also became a merchant in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells household and personal products, such as irons, fans, shoes, and perfumes among many other things.  She sells door to door, offers her products to her customers, takes orders, and delivers her merchandise on credit.  She collects each week.  She’s been doing this for seven years and things are going well for her, but things have gotten better now that she can get loans.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, shoes, irons, toasters, and other things.  She’s been a member of the communal bank from the beginning and she enjoys it because it helps her obtain loans.

Her dream is to improve her business.

The small photograph is of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.  The children are some of the members’.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en: Maldrine is a 37-year-old lady who deals in second hand cloth.  She has run this business for a period of eight years.  She started with agriculture and, after a good sale of the harvest, she ventured into the cloth retailing business.  She says inadequate capital and high taxes are affecting her business.  She would like to buy a car and expand her business to new markets.  Maldrine is requesting a loan to buy bed sheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is the mother of four children, all of whom are construction workers. She is 38 years old and lives in the Mongkol Borey District. This is her third loan with VisionFund. Thorn is the leader of this 2-member group.

Before her first loan, Thorn worked for others as a construction worker and saved money to rent a rice paddy plot for farming. Thorn has repaid her previous loans regularly and on time. Now that the second loan has ended, she has requested another loan from VisionFund, hoping to get money to rent a rice paddy plot for farming and to buy fertilizers. With this loan, Thorn hopes to make more income to help her family have better living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a rice paddy plot and to buy fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Viviana  Cenith

texts.es: Viviana invirtió su anterior credikiva en mercancía con la que surtió su negocio, compró también un exhibidor, debido a que el que tenía era muy pequeño y no podía surtirlo de acuerdo con las expectativas del mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará harinas, café, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, jugos y cambiará una vitrina que esta en muy mal estado. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “ Gracias por el apoyo y la confianza que me han brindado y espero que sigan apoyándonos para cumplir de tener mi propia casa.”
texts.en: Viviana invested her previous Kiva loan in merchandise to stock up her business. She also bought a showcase since her old one was too small and she couldn’t fill it with the demands of the market. Currently, she is requesting a new Kiva loan so she can buy flour, coffee, rice, sugar, soda, juice and so she can replace a glass window that’s in bad shape. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: Thank you for giving me your support and trust, and I hope you will continue to support us so I can achieve my goal of having my own home.

loans.use: buy flour, coffee, rice, sugar, soda, juice and replace a glass window.

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en:
Batkhuu is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her son and daughter, ages 23 and 24, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small house in the outer 'ger' district (a district without basic infrastructure). Batkhuu’s son is a web designer and her daughter works as a teacher at a local public school. 

Batkhuu supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2003, Batkhuu had 800,000 MNT in working capital. Today, her business has grown and she has about 4,000,000 MNT in working capital. Batkhuu sells jeans and trousers. “I want to grow my business more with this loan and I would like to be able to buy my own apartment in the future and live there with my family,” she says. 

Because it is the beginning of the high shopping season, Batkhuu is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to increase the variety of jeans and trousers she sells.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
MARCO ANTONIO tiene 29 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive  con los padres y el hijo de 1 año de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.
MARCO ANTONIO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, trigo, fréjol y mora. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos químicos y orgánicos, líquidos para la maleza y monte, insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para mejorar los cultivos. El sueño es poder mejorar  la vivienda y comprar tierra. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es pagar con puntualidad las cuotas del crédito. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 29 years old. He is single and has a son. He lives with his parents and his son, who is 1 year old, in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. The communal bank Virgen de Baños was formed in the Mama Sara community in Cerritos. The members dedicate the greater part of their time to agriculture, the planting of corn and the raising of animals.

Marco Antonio works in agriculture. He plants corn, wheat, beans, and blackberries. He is applying for a loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, liquids for the weeds, herbicides, and insecticides. He makes his purchases and sales in Chillanes.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers to improve his crops. His dream is to be able to improve his home and buy land. The challenges that he faces are making his loan payments on time.

In his free time, he likes to play indoor soccer and watch television.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, liquids for weeds, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Con su credikiva Claudia compró mucha yuca y preparó masa en su proceso productivo. él logró vender mucho mas en los diversos puntos de comidas rápidas. En la actualidad se prepara para acceder a un nuevo credikiva y planea nuevamente comprar en mayor volumen su materia prima principal; "La Yuca" porque esta dispuesta a incrementar la prooducciòn de masa y asì mismo atender la demanda se sus clientes reales y consolidar nuevos compradores. Su inversiòn es exitosa porque trabaja con calidad para ofrecer un producto saludable que a su clientela les gusta porque atrae tambien mas clientes para ellos. su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:"agradecida con todos ustedes, por apoyar a los soñadores, a que estos se cumplan sus metas gracias a la ayuda de los créditos. "
texts.en:
Claudia purchased a lot of yuca with her Kiva loan, and prepared paste in her productive process. She was able to sell a lot more at different fast food spots. 
Currently she is getting ready to access a new Kiva loan and is planning to again purchase a greater amount of her main raw material - yuca - because she is willing to increase her paste production and also to fulfill her real clients' demand and consolidate new buyers.
Her investment is successful because she works with quality to offer a healthy product that her customers enjoy because it also attracts more customers for them.
Her message to her Kiva financial backers is the following: "I am grateful to all of you, for supporting the dreamers, so that they can reach their goals thanks to the help of the loans."

loans.use: to purchase yuca in bulk

loans.name: Bilma Raquel

texts.es:
La Señora. Bilma es socia del banco comunal La Merced, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana ubicada al sureste de Cuenca, es de clima frió y desde su parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales,  a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad.
 
La Señora, Bilma tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 12, 10 y 1 año  de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en la escuelita. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en el transporte público, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus padres compartiendo gastos del hogar.

Doña Bilma se dedica a la venta de de cerdos hace 6 meses, también se dedica a laborar como docente en un programa de alfabetización para jóvenes y adultos, trabaja de lunes a viernes medio día y los fines de semana todo el día.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Bilma is a member of the La Merced communal bank.  She lives in the Santa Ana parish, located in the southeast of Cuenca.  The climate is cold and one can see most of the city from its central park.  Its residents raise livestock, farm, and many work in the city.

Bilma is 30 years old, is married, and has three children, ages 12, 10, and 1.  Her two oldest attend school.  Her husband is a driver and provides public transportation services.  They don’t have a home of their own, but live in their parents’  home and share in the household expenses.

Bilma has been selling hogs for the past six months and also teaches in a literacy program for youngsters and adults.  She works half days Monday through Friday and all day on the weekends.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 10 years and will invest her new loan into hogs so that she can continue her business.
Her goal is to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy hogs.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn is 61 years old.  She is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling Khmer noodles (rice noodles topped with a green fish gravy, fresh vegetables and other greens) for over two years, earning approximately $2 per day.  Her two children are employed as a dealer and a factory worker.  They earn approximately $6 per day.  

Due to the difficulty caused by her family’s living without a water supply, Morn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay to have a well dug in order to supply water for her family to use.  

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate extra income to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for a well to be dug for her family's use.

loans.name: Henry Manuel

texts.es: Henry con su credikiva anterior compró leche en el municipio de Concordia (departamento del Magdalena), donde residen sus padres y hermanos; él también vendió queso y suero que le  enviaron y logró ganar mas clientes y mas dinero. Henry quedó muy contento y comprará una vez mas estos productos, para responder a su  clientela que cada vez mas se multiplican. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: "Gracias por apoyarme en mi negocio ya que he crecido por contar con un capital que he invertido logrando asì crecer."
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Henry purchased milk purchased in the municipality of Concordia (department of Magdalena), where his parents and siblings live. He also sold the cheese and whey that they sent him and managed to earn more customers and more money. Henry was quite pleased and will buy these products once again, to respond to his increasing customer base. His message to funders is as follows: "Thank you for supporting me with my business which I have grown by investing the capital to earn more growth"

loans.use: Cheese whey and milk

loans.name: Abdurozik

texts.ru: Абдурозик женат и на воспитании имеет одного сына. Более 6 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. Он приобретает скот на местном рынке,  откармливает их в течении определенного периода, а потом продает за выгодную цену. Абдурозик в обороте имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота. С наступлением весны  закончился корм для скота, и поэтому обращается за помощью. Абдурозик запрашивает займ для покупки корма для крупного рогатого скота и надеется в поддержке.
texts.en: Abdurozik is married and has one son. He has been buying and selling cattle for six years. He buys the cattle on the local market, feeds it for a period of time and then sells at a more profitable price. Abdurozik has seven heads of large horned cattle in stock. With the coming of spring he ran out of fodder for the cattle and this is why he is asking for help. Abdurozik is asking for a loan to buy fodder for the large horned cattle and is hoping for support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cattle.

loans.name: Rodesa

texts.en:
Rodesa is 36 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Rodesa is engaged in a hog-raising business that primarily involves hogs for breeding. It is a business she started several years ago. 

As of now, Rodesa wants to expand her business. This is why she is taking out this loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and additional hogs to raise. This business helps Rodesa because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 31-year-old young married man. He is a father of two sons and one daughter.

For the past three years, Rami has had a sewing workshop for sewing and selling clothes to customers. It has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover the costs.

Rami wants to expand the size of his workshop to meet the high demand of customers’ requests, as he has a good reputation in the market. So he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing an additional new sewing machine. This will increase the number of sewing machines he has in the workshop, which will help him to finish sewing clothes on time. This will lead to increased sales and will improve the family's income.

Rami is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, Ica, Perú. El distrito de la Tinguiña es muy conocido por su festividad de la virgen de la Nieves, asimismo se le conoce por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Cuando Maria dispone de un tiempo libre le agrada salía a pasear en especial  con sus retoños ya que es madre de de 4 hijos y cuyas edades comprenden 19, 17,10 y un bebe de 7 meses, ella los ama muchísimo por ello siempre aprovecha un tiempo para estar con ellos ya que ella no solo es madre sino su amiga de cada uno de ellos; le gusta cocinar y cuando lo hace le encanta preparar su platillo favorito el cual son “los tallarines rojos”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería, por ello trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante a sus hijos para que sean mejores que ella.

Cada día María se levanta con mucho optimismo para trabajar en  su negocio de venta de CD, asimismo realiza trabajos de tipeos y trabajos de investigación y fotocopiado, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trata de manera amable a los clientes.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora para poder seguir realizando sus trabajos de tipeo; lo que le permitirá contar con una mejor herramienta para realizar bien su trabajo y así seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad du sueño:” Tener sucursales de su negocio”.
texts.en:
María lives in the district of La Tinguiña, Ica, Peru.  The district is very well known for its festival of the Virgen de las Nieves as well as for the friendliness of its residents.

When María has some free time she likes to go out, especially with her kids, because she is the mother of four children, whose ages are 19, 17, 10, and a seven-month-old baby.  She loves them very much, so she always takes advantage of the time to be with them, because she is not only their mother but also the friend of each one of them.  She likes to cook, and when she does it she loves to prepare her favorite dish, "taillarines rojos" [spaghetti with a red sauce].

Because of her parents' limited economic resources, she only did secondary studies, but she would have liked to study nursing.  For this reason she works very hard to get her children ahead, so they can be better than her.

Every day María gets up with a lot of optimism to work in her business selling CDs.  She also does typing jobs and research and photocopying jobs.  She works about 10 hours and can serve up to 30 customers a day.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she treats the customers in a friendly manner.

María is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the great help they have given her, she will be able to buy a computer to continue doing her typing jobs.  This will allow her to have a better tool to do her job well and continue fighting every day to make her dream a reality: "To have offices in her neighborhood."

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to establish the tilapia business and purchase chickens to fatten.  She will diversify her business to lessen the risks.

loans.name: 32-Principiantes Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 32 PRINCIPIANTES esta  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco de emprendimiento es la Sra. Elena tiene 53 años no esta casada pero tiene un hijo que ya es independientes, ella se dedica a al venta de dulces en una tiendita que se encuentran en la zona Villa Pagador, la Sra. Elena es cliente antigua de la institución ya que esta es la novena secuencia de su crédito, la Sra. Elena utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de dulces por mayor para surtir su tiendita y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, la Sra. Elena es una persona muy trabajadora, saco a su hijo adelante sola por lo que se siente orgullosa y feliz.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "32 Principiantes" (32 Beginners) consists of eight members, six women and two men. The president of this Communal Bank is Sra. Elena. She is 53 years old, but she is not married and has a son who is independent. She sells candy from a small shop in the District of Villa Pagador. Sra. Elena is a longtime client of Emprender and is participating in her ninth loan cycle. She will use this loan to buy candy in bulk so that she can restock her shop and increase her operating capital.

Sra. Elena confronts challenges in her business, such as competition, so she will utilize these benefits in order to improve her quality of life. She is a hardworking individual who is able by herself to help her son get ahead. She is very pleased and proud of this accomplishment.

loans.use: to buy candy in bulk.

loans.name: Mercedes Jannet

texts.es:
MERCEDES JANNET tiene 46 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en Montalvo provincia de los Ríos.
La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios
MERCEDES JANNET tiene una tienda de víveres, además vende chuzos carne en palito. Solicita el crédito para comprar carne, mayonesa, mostaza, papas. 
Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Babahoyo cada quince días y las ventas lo hace en Montalvo diariamente.
Su sueño es  seguir trabajando y poder aumentar el capital. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  es  la  competencia y la pérdida del capital.
Su tiempo libre lo dedica a leer y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mercedes Jannet is 46 years old, single, and has three children. She and her children live in Montalvo in Los Ríos Province.

The San Joaquín Communal Bank is located 15 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office in Montalvo. This group consists of 12 members.

Mercedes Jannet has a shop where she sells food, including grilled meats on a stick. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, mayonnaise, mustard, and potatoes. Her purchases are made in the city of Babahoyo every 15 days and she sells in Montalvo every day. She dreams of continuing her work and being able to increase her capital. The challenges she faces include dealing with the competition and losing capital.

In her free time, Mercedes Jannet enjoys reading and playing sports.

loans.use: to buy meat, mayonnaise, mustard, and potatoes.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena de 21 años  tienen un pequeño negocio debajo de un palo de mango; ella prepara comidas, como arroz, sopa, legumbres, sancochos etc. que vende diariamente y de contado. Con su negocio le ha ido muy bien y tiene un potencial de crecimiento, necesita extenderse a otros productos como comidas rápidas diversificando así su oferta y potencializando nuevos clientes, que son los que generan la sostenibilidad de su negocio. Lorena inició este negocio desde hace 4 años en su casa y poco a poco fue creciendo, por eso buscó mayor amplitud ubicándose en un parque muy cerca a su vivienda. Su principal mercado son sus vecinos, trabajadores y transeúntes que pasan por su negocio y se detienen a realizar su compra, para continuar con su camino. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará arroz, aceite, carnes, verduras, etc, así mismo comprará sillas, y un carro de comidas rápidas para empezar a diversificar su oferta, tal cual sus clientes le han sugerido, ganando descuentos por compras de contado y esto es lo que justamente hará que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Lorena, 21, has a small business underneath a mango tree.  She prepares food, such as rice, soup, vegetables, roasts, etc., which she sells daily and for cash.  Her business has gone very well for her and it has the potential for growth.  She needs to expand into other products such as fast food, diversifying her offerings and increasing her new customers, which are what generates the sustainability of her business.

Lorena started this business four years ago in her house and little by little it grew.  This is why she sought more space, locating herself in a park very close to her house.   Her main market is her neighbors, workers, and passersby who go by her business and stop to make their purchases and continue on their way.

Currently she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy rice, oil, meat, vegetables, etc.  She also will buy chairs and a fast-food cart to begin to diversify her offerings (just as her customers have suggested to her), getting discounts for paying in cash.  This is exactly what will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: La Sra. Aquilina tiene 42 años y es soltera con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 14 años, su actividad es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una tienda de barrio que se encuentran en cerca del mercado de la localidad de Sacaba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Aquilina utilizara este préstamo para la compra de productos para surtir su tienda como dulces, refrescos y abarrotes y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. Aquilina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y utilizara los beneficios  en la compra de mucha mas mercadería  para seguir surtiendo su tienda,  Su  sueño para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Aquilina, 42, is single and has a 14 year-old child.  She has a business selling consumer staples in a store in her neighborhood, which is located near the market in the town of Sacaba.  This is her first loan with the institution.  Aquilina will use the loan to buy products to stock her store, such as sweets, beverages and groceries.  In this way she can increase her working capital.  The reason she is requesting this loan is that she doesn't have enough money to buy everything that she needs. Aquilina faces challenges with her business, such as the competition.  She will use the profits to purchase a lot more merchandise so that she can continue to keep her store well-stocked.  Her dream for her business is to have a stable and profitable business.  She is grateful for the opportunity that is being provided with this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beverages, sweets and groceries

loans.name: Rufino Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Rufino es un hombre muy luchador, que con el paso de los años ha logrado esforzarse cada vez más con el fin de poder salir adelante y demostrarse a sí mismo que puede convertirse en un microempresario de éxito.

Tras la separación  con su esposa, Rufino empezó a emprender solo una vida comercial, ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Rufino siempre quiso convertirse en profesor, ya que siempre ha percibido en sí mismo que tiene el don para enseñar, pero lamentablemente no pudo cumplir este sueño debido a que sus padres no tenían el ingreso necesario para poder pagar sus estudios.

Rufino ha afrontado muchos retos y poco a poco ha logrado surgir, es por eso que con mucho esfuerzo logró juntar poco de dinero, es así como abrió su tienda, la cual actualmente es alquilada y en ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. 

Actualmente Rufino necesita un poco de apoyo, ya que con esto lograra invertir en la compra de ropa nueva (Polos, Shorts, Pantalones,etc.), ya que sus clientes siempre le preguntan si tiene nuevos modelos o diseños, es entonces este el principal motivo por el que quiere crecer como microempresario, ya que sabe que sus ingresos mejorarán. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación desea poder abrir un nuevo puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado, pero en este caso si desea que el local sea suyo, así dejará de pagar el alquiler y ahorra de a pocos para convertir su gran sueño en realidad “Tener una cadena de tiendas a nivel nacional”.
texts.en:
Sr. Rufino is a very hardworking man who, over the years, has endeavored to get ahead and demonstrate to himself that he can become a successful small businessman.
