texts.es: Elsa Isolina de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una venta de piñatas en su residencia, tiene de diferentes estilos, al gusto de su clientela, princesas, muñecos de acción, caricaturas de moda, tradicionales, entre otros, desde hace un tiempo aumento la demanda de su producto pues están realizadas con material de primera calidad, elaboradas con dedicación y además a precios realmente accesibles; Elsa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, tiene muchos objetivos por alcanzar a futuro, piensa que el éxito en la vida de una persona está en prepararse para aprovechar la ocasión cuando se le presente, ella está preparada es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar papelería, alambre, pegamento y cartoncillo, etc a fin de elaborar las demás piñatas que demandan sus clientes y para las cuales no cuentan con recursos propios. Elsa Isolina tiene fe que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Elsa Isolina, 48 years old, lives with her children in her own house. She sells piñatas in her home. She has different styles, according to the tastes of her customers - princesses, action figures, popular cartoons, and traditional, among others. Some time ago demand for her products increased, since they are made with materials of the highest quality and with dedication, and at really accessible prices. Elsa is a woman dedicated to her work. She has many goals for the future. She thinks that success in a person's life lies in preparing oneself to take advantage of the opportunity when it appears, and she is prepared. This is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy paper products, wire, glue, paperboard, etc., in order to make the other piñatas that her customers ask for, and for which they do not have their own resources. Elsa Isolina has faith that in this way she will be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to purchase paper products and wire

loans.name: Konotie Yele Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Konotie Yele, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, le commerce d’habillements et de parures, des poissons etc.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Konotie yele sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MARIAM, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter dix colis contenant chacun 20 calebasses avec les exploitantes de la commune de Massigui  et du village de Tona pour ensuite vendre  pendant les jours de foire au marché de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de calebasses.
texts.en:
The women of the Konotie Yele group are all married. Their average age is 42 years old, and they have about three children each. They all live in large extended families in the village of Konobougou, in the Ségou region (fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They were introduced to one another by relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell prepared food, clothing, jewellery, fish, etc. The women of the Konotie Yele group are on their 16th group loan. 

Mariam, second from the right in the photo, plans to buy ten packages containing 20 calabashes each from farmers in the town of Massigui and the village of Tona. She will then sell the calabashes at the market in Konobougou to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of her family. Part of the profit will be reinvested in her calabash-selling business.

loans.use: to buy calabashes

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana es de Condición muy Humilde, de estado Civil Casada, tiene dos hijos a quienes apoya moral y económicamente, trabaja como Trabajadora de Hogar más de 7 años en la misma casa, sus jefes le adoran y confían mucho en ella, su esposo trabaja como Albañil. Se les dio la oportunidad de poder comprar un Terreno en una Urbanización reciente de la  ciudad de Tarija , en la cual quieren construir, por ello solicitan el crédito en Cidre para poder de esa manera mejorar un poco más su condición de vida ya que la mayoría de esa Urbanización  ya terminaron de Construir sus casas , casi es la única casa de la Señora Roxana que esta con solo dos cuartos y ahí viven incómodos con sus dos hijos, por lo cual sería bueno que siga construyendo para que sus hijos estén cómodos y puedan realizar sus tareas de la mejor manera posible, pues así tendrán un espacio amplio donde puedan seguir estudiando y llegar a ser profesionales con el apoyo económico de sus padres.
texts.en: Roxana is a very humble person. She has a common-law husband and 2 children to whom she gives moral and economic support. She has worked as a domestic employee in the same house for more than 7 years. Her bosses adore her and put a lot of trust in her. Her husband is a mason. They had the opportunity to buy some land in a new development in the city of Tarija and they want to build a house there so they are requesting a loan from Cidre so that they can improve their quality of life. Most people in this development have already finished building their houses. Roxana's is almost the only house that only has two rooms and they are uncomfortable living there with their 2 children, so it will be good for them to continue the construction so that their children can be comfortable and do their homework in the best way possible. They will have plenty of space to study and become professionals with economic help from their parents.

loans.use: to build her home.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from one to three years. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, spinach, and onions. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are local residents of her village area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables . Maureen's dream and business goal is to own another grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Ri

texts.en:
Ri is 67 years old and a diligent mother of six children, living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She grows and sells vegetables to earn a living. She has her children help in managing this business as she becomes older. However, her spouse is the main income provider of the family. He travels by buffalo going through the commune and market with a trailer full of firewood to sell.

At the present, Ri is taking out a loan to buy cashew nuts in bulk in order to resell them for a profit. With her hard work and the help of this loan, Ri hopes that she will be able to attain success from her investment and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk in order to resell them for a profit.

loans.name: Lerng

texts.en:
Lerng, age 57, is a loving father of four children; three are married and the other one is single. He’s a widower who lives with his children in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Lerng is involved in the firewood-selling business to provide the income for the family.

He would like to sustain and improve his business but he has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan to purchase stock of firewood for continuous sales. He has been a client of HKL for a few years. This will be his third loan, and he found that it’s very useful to make changes in his living status.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood for continuous sales.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is a responsible mother who strives to provide a good standard of living for the family. She is 26 years old and has two school-aged children. She earns a living by doing farming, raising pigs, and selling Khmer cake in the commune. Kean would like to expand her farming business to increase her production and income to satisfy her family’s basic necessities in the coming years. She told us that the main important thing in her life is to provide a good education to her two children. For that reason, she has a commitment to work hard and continually support them, so that they can earn a degree and become professionals someday. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase construction supplies and to pay for the construction fees. She hopes to see her house done soon, and it will be a comfortable one for the whole family. She is very happy for the given funds to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and to pay for construction fees.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Adzovi est une femme âgée de 38ans. Elle a 02 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 17ans et le dernier 07ans. Elle est restauratrice depuis 2005 et exerce son activité dans un bar de la place. Elle est aidée par 02 personnes et s’approvisionne généralement au marché. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des ingrédients pour la restauration ( maïs, riz, tubercules d’ignames , tomates..). Elle  veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir un réfrigérateur pour mettre au frais les boissons des clients et assurer l’apprentissage de son fils ainé.
texts.en:
Adzovi is a 38-year-old woman. She has two children, both of whom attend school. Her eldest child is 17 years old, and her youngest child is 7.

She has been running a restaurant since 2005, located in a local bar. She has two people who help her, and she usually stocks up at the market.

She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy ingredients for her restaurant (corn, rice, yam tubers, tomatoes..). She wants to reinvest in her business, have a refrigerator to keep her clients' drinks cool, and ensure the training of her eldest son.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, yams, and rice for her bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 2 children whose ages range from 5 years to 7 years. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a grocery store  where she sells fruit such as mangoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more mangoes for selling. Her business goal is to own several such fruit-selling grocery stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, Ella posee una tienda en un chalet dentro del centro escolar de su localidad y en su residencia por las tardes una venta de pupusas, es muy conocida en la zona pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, es una mujer con mucha fuerza interior para superar obstaculos, además el servicio es excelente; Rosa es una mujer con muchas metas por alcanzar siempre dispuesta a valorar cada oportunidad que se le presente, su labor es hacer crecer el negocio y mantenerlo adelante de la competencia,  por eso quiere mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda en la que posee su pupuseria a fin de tener una mejor imagen del negocio e higiene para la clientela, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para colocar piso cerámico. Rosa Amelia tiene la determinación que éste es un importante cambio que servirá para mejorar el negocio y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor
texts.en: 59 year-old Rosa Amelia lives with her life partner and their children in their own home. She has a store in a house in the local school and, in the afternoons, she sells pupusas from her house. She is well known in the area as everything she sells is of a very good quality and she sells at affordable prices. She is a woman with a lot of internal strength for overcoming obstacles, and she gives her clients good service. Rosa is a woman who has a lot of goals that she wants to achieve and she always takes good advantage of opportunities that come her way. Her task is to grow her business and stay ahead of the competition. For this reason, she wants to improve her home where she has her store selling pupusas so that her business will have a better image and better hygiene for her customers. This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to put down a ceramic tile floor. She is sure that this is an important change to better serve her customers and to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy ceramic floor tiles, cement, and glue.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es: Jaime Alberto de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su mama y su hermano en casa propia. Él se dedica a la confección de ropa de deporte, pans, licras, camisetas entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de más clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de excelente calidad, usa las mejores telas y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es único, en estas vacaciones Jaime quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para aumentar sus ventas, ya que muchas personas se dedicaran al deporte en estos días libres, él es un hombre capaz, responsable y con muy buenas ideas, piensa que solo la constancia y el amor al trabajo permitirán que llegue al éxito, quiere obtenerlo por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor. Jaime Alberto tiene la esperanza que así podrá mejorar la situación de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Jaime Alberto, 22 years old, lives with his mother and his brother in their own house. He makes sportswear, pants, lycra shorts, and t-shirts, among other items. Lately he has had more customers because everything he sells is of excellent quality. He uses the best fabrics and he sells his items at really accessible prices. Also, the service is extraordinary. This vacation season, Jaime wants to take advantage of the opportunity to increase his sales, since many people play sports during these days off. He is a capable, responsible man with very good ideas. He thinks that only perseverance and love of the work will allow him to succeed. He wants to succeed, so that is why he decided to ask Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy wholesale fabric. Jaime Alberto hopes that in this way he will be able to improve the living situation in his home.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou,  Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce d’habillements de calebasses et de poisson.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FAFA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter 40 complets d’habits pour enfants, 5 douzaines de pots pour boire, 20 seaux en plastique et les ingrédients pour la fabrication du parfums avec les fournisseurs de Bamako pour ensuite vendre à domicile, en ambulante et au marché de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de d’habits et de parfums.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguidolo group, composed of married women and widows, average 37 years of age with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Konobougou, Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They cook food for sale and sell clothing,  gourds and fish. 

The members of the Siguidolo group are on their seventh solidarity loan.
Fafa, the second one from the right, plans to buy 40 outfits for children, five dozen mugs, 20 plastic pails and the ingredients for making perfume from the suppliers in Bamako in order to resell them later out of her home, as a street vendor and at the market of Konobougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used for family needs, with part of reinvested in her clothing and perfumes business.

loans.use: to buy various articles for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, tiene 27 Años, vive en el trópico de Cochabamba en la localidad de entre ríos, es madre soltera, actualmente se dedica al comercio de fruta de temporada.
La señora  vino al trópico, de otra comunidad donde hay demasiada pobreza, buscando  mayor oportunidad de trabajo y un mejor nivel de vida para ella y para su pequeña hija, porque en su comunidad en los últimos tiempos afecto el desborde de los ríos y afecto a sus cultivos, apenas alcanzaba  para sobrevivir.
Cuando llegó indica, que se vino con unas cuantas ropas, en los primeros años que vino ayudaba a cargar fruta de temporada y llevaban a la ciudad de santa cruz, para su comercialización, aun  no podía encontrar un trabajo seguro, poco a poco fue aprendiendo el negocio del comercio de fruta, para posteriormente dedicarse a este rubro, trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo y que no le falte nada en un futuro.
Con el transcurso del tiempo fue  ahorrando poco a poco y fue comprándose un lote urbano y se hizo una pequeña habitación donde actualmente vive, ahora  la  clienta solicita el crédito para capital de operación y con ello comprar más fruta, para seguir creciendo y de esa manera sobresalir de esta situación tan pobre que vive, y posteriormente quiere mejorar su vivienda, para lo cual necesita incrementar su ingresos, y  con el crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 27, lives in tropical Cochabamba in Entre Ríos.  She is a single mother, and she currently sells seasonal fruit.  She came to the tropics from another community where there was too much poverty.  She came looking for a greater opportunity to work and a better standard of living for herself and her young daughter. In the past seasons her community was affected by the rivers flooding, and it affected her crops.  She barely managed to survive.

She says that when she came she brought a few clothes.  In the first few years after she came she helped carry seasonal fruit and take it to the city of Santa Cruz to sell.  She still was not able to find secure work.

Little by little she was learning the business of selling fruit in order to later enter this field.  She works very hard to get her child ahead and so that her child will lack nothing in the future.

As time passed she was saving little by little.  She bought an urban lot, and she made a small room where she currently lives.

She is now requesting a loan for working capital.  She will use the loan to buy more fruit in order to continue growing.  This way she will overcome this very poor situation in which she lives.  Later she wants to improve her house.  To do so she needs to increase her income.  With the loan she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a thirty-two year old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from four to six. He describes himself as intelligent. He has a motorcycle which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a densely populated area and along a tarmac road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to run a stable transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has seven children whose ages range from twenty-seven to thirty. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent room to run her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes. Ruth's dream and business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy one bale of skirts to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. Gladys is involved in the transport industry; a business she started from her savings. Besides this, Gladys also sells clothes.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends. Owing to the desire to obtain more income for her family needs, Gladys is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to start a grocery/vegetable shop. 

Her future ambition is to increase the number of motor cycles in the transport business and believes the additional income from both businesses will help her achieve her long term desire of building rental houses.

loans.use: To start a grocery/vegetable shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydiah is a single woman. She has 2 children whose ages range from 10 to 15 years. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail stall where she sells cereals such as beans, maize and black beans. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals in large quantities within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia de sesenta y uno años de edad ya tiene casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, huevo, pan, bebidas entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es único, siempre recibe a las personas con mucha alegría; María es una mujer muy trabajadora, enérgica y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que el éxito no está en el dinero ni en la riqueza, si no en el alma, con este pensamiento se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas, etc. María Julia tiene confianza que de esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Julia is 60 years old, and she has her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic needs products like rice, beans, eggs, bread, and drinks, among others.  She is well known in the area, and she has gotten a lot of customers.

She always has what people need, her products are very good quality, and she sells her products for accessible prices.  Also, her service is unique.  She always greets people very cheerfully.

María is a very hard-working and energetic woman with a lot of enthusiasm for getting ahead.  She believes that success is not in the money or in the wealth; it is in the soul.  It is with this thought that she decided to request a loan from Integral.  

The loan will allow her to buy basic grains, bread, and drinks, etc.  María Julia is confident that this way she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 30-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a self-motivated woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services  such as blowdrying and plaiting. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located near an estate and bus station and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a dryer. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have the biggest salon in her business area.

loans.use: to buy another dryer.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 50-year-old married man. He has 5 children whose ages range from 2 to 6 years. He describes himself as a self-motivated man. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a shortage of charcoal. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase twenty bags of charcoal. His business goal is to buy a motorcycle to aid in delivery of charcoal to customers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be selling charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AÏDOTE est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Sophie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sophie est âgée de 28 ans. Sophie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Paul. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sophie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Sophie vend de la farine de manioc, de l’arachide et de façon secondaire du pain à son domicile mais aussi par le système de distribution depuis quatre ans. Sophie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sophie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AÏDOTE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Aïdote group comprises thirteen people who live in the same area. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of their business. The group representative, named Sophie, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Sophie is 28 years old. She is married to a driver named Paul. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Sophie did not attend school. To provide for herself, for the past four years Sophie has sold manioc flour, peanuts, and sometimes bread as well, both at her home and through the distribution system. Sophie gets her supplies in a city in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales volume and income, Sophie is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Aïdote group. The previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy bags of manioc flour and cans of peanut oil.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, sodas, stationery and bread. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy estate and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of room for the business operation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy two bags of flour. Her business goal is to own another retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more room for the business operation.

loans.use: to buy two bags of flour.

loans.name: Yanira De Los Santos

texts.es: Yanira de los Santos de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su hija, ella posee una sala de belleza donde realiza todo tipo de peinados, maquillaje, lavados de cabello entre otros, siempre ha tenido mucha clientela pero últimamente ha aumentado aún más la demanda pues todo la que realiza es de excelente calidad, con los mejores productos y a precios bajos; Yanira es una mujer muy dedicada a su labor siempre dispuesta a aprovechar oportunidades que se le presenten para poder triunfar, piensa  que  el éxito está determinado por el hecho de tomar las cartas que te repartieron y utilizarlas con lo mejor de tu habilidad, quiere jugar sus cartas es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, tintes, herramienta de trabajo, entre otras cosas que aún no posee. Yanira tiene fe que este es un importante cambio para que su negocio mejores y aperturar opciones para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yanira de los Santos, age 39, lives with her daughter.  She has a beauty parlor where she does all types of hairstyles, make-up, and shampoos, among others.  She has always had a lot of customers, but lately the demand has increased even more.  

Everything that she does is of excellent quality and with the best products and low prices.  Yanira is a woman who is very devoted to her work.  She is always ready to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves in order to be able to triumph.

She thinks that success is determined by taking the cards you are dealt and using them to the best of your ability.  She wants to play her cards.  That is why she decided to request a loan from Integral.  A loan will allow her to buy creams, dyes, and work tools, among other things that she still does not have.

Yanira has faith that this is an important change so that her business improves and that options open so that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, dyes, and work tools.

loans.name: Djodjina

texts.fr: Djodjina est une femme âgée de 55ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et ont ensemble 02enfants. L’ainé a 27ans et le dernier 18ans. Madame Djodjina est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1993. Elle vend de façon ambulante et est à son cinquième prêt. Sa difficulté est la mévente. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes, avoir un stock important et assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en: Djodjine is a 55-year-old woman. She is married to a driver, and the couple have two children. The elder child is 27 years old and the younger is 18. Ms. Djodjina has been a retailer of pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing) since 1993. She sells door-to-door and is on her fifth loan. Her main difficulty is a slump in sales. She is seeking this loan to buy and build up a significant stock of pagnes, and thus to ensure a bright future for her children.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing)

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito tiene 27 años de edad vive en Barrio Alto en el municipio de Villa Tunari de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa trabajo vendiendo refresco y el señor Benito  es  vendedor ambulante de ropa nueva.
Benito es joven y entusiasta muy deportista y su gran debilidad es que  confía en la gente con mucha facilidad, por lo que perdió un dinero que presto a unos conocidos quienes desaparecieron después de pedirle prestado sin dejar rastro y ninguna referencia,  lastimosamente el dinero que les dio como préstamo era para poder terminar de cancelar el saldo que debía el de su casita que había adquirido, por lo que se complico con la cancelación de su casa y tambien con su familia le proboco conflictos muy granves . Siendo que ahora el requiere de un préstamo para poder cancelar la deuda que esta pendiente de su casa, el seguirá trabajando y repondrá el dinero perdido con su esfuerzo y así demostrara que puede recobrar lo que perdió con mucho empeño y también, ahora vive con el escarrmiento y con la voluntad de enmendar su error, solo necesita un apoyo para no perder su casa.
texts.en:
Benito is 27 years old and lives in Barrio Alto in the town of Villa Tunari in the city of Cochabamba.  He’s married and has two children.  His wife works selling soft-drinks and Benito is a street peddler selling new clothes.

Benito is an enthusiastic young man, very sports oriented.  But his great downfall is that he trusts people very easily which is why he lost some money he lent to some acquaintances who vanished after asking him for the loan; they left no traces or references.  Sadly, the money he lent them was what he intended to use to pay off the loan he’d taken out to pay for his little house he’d gotten.  Therefore, paying off the loan got complicated and serious problems with his family arose too because of this.  

Seeing as how he needs a loan to pay off the pending house loan he will continue working and will replace the lost money with his effort thus showing that with much effort he can recover what he lost too.  He’s now learned his lesson and is willing to rectify his mistake; he just needs a little help in order not to lose his house.

loans.use: to pay off his home loan.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María Gloria de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un tortillería en el lugar donde reside pero además se dedica también a la venta de chocobanano (guineo recubierto de chocolate refrigerado, es muy conocida en el lugar y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela ya que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad con tortillas calientitas entregadas en poco tiempo además el servicio es muy bueno; María es una mujer con muchos sueños para el futuro siempre está dispuesta a triunfar, piensa que las personas  no son recordadas por el número de veces que fracasan, sino por el número de veces que tienen éxito, y ella será recordada por sus triunfos, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, bananos, chocolate, entre otros. María Gloria tiene la esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Gloria is 44 years old and lives with her spouse and children in her own house.  She has a tortilla shop at home but she also sells “chocobanano” (frozen, chocolate-covered bananas).  She’s very well known in the area and has acquired a large clientele lately because everything she sells is good quality with nice and warm tortillas that are delivered quickly.  Besides, her service is very good.

María is a person with many dreams for the future who is always willing to succeed.  She feels that people are not remembered for the number of times they fail but for the number of times they succeed and she will be remembered for her successes.  

Because of this, she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, bananas and chocolate, among others.  María Gloria hopes this way to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, propane gas, bananas and chocolate, among others.
